definition: to talk about often/to reminisce about/to keep repeating/to keep harping on/to discuss

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])

sentences.english: During the meeting, Tom kept murmuring about his salary.
sentences.chinese: 開會期間，湯姆喋喋不休地念叨着他的工資。

sentences.english: Bridal chamber, drunken j&js mouth constantly chanting the names of the seven sister.
sentences.chinese: 洞房中，酒醉的強生嘴裏不斷念叨七妹的名字。

definition: to be chattersome/to talk on and on without stopping/to nag
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
to read silently/to mouth (the words of a prayer etc)/to say to oneself/to contemplate inwardly
to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize
